intro: Zeuxine flava, commonly known as the yellow sandroot, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae, which includes buttercups and other similar species. The plant is characterized by its yellow flowers and its ability to thrive in dry, sandy soils. Its leaves are alternate and have a distinctive lobed shape, while its roots are fleshy and often used in traditional medicine. Zeuxine flava is also known for its ornamental value due to its vibrant color and unique appearance.
